title: Paul Hagen (sportswriter)
text:
Paul Hagen (born c. 1950) is an American <a href="sports%20columnist">sports columnist</a> who covers <a href="baseball">baseball</a>.
Hagen attended <a href="Ohio%20University">Ohio University</a>. He began his career in 1974 working in <a href="San%20Bernardino%2C%20California">San Bernardino, California</a>, where he covered the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Dodgers">Los Angeles Dodgers</a> for three years. Hagen also worked in the <a href="Dallas%E2%80%93Fort%20Worth%20metroplex">Dallas–Fort Worth</a> area for ten years covering the <a href="Texas%20Rangers%20%28baseball%29">Texas Rangers</a> for the "<a href="Dallas%20Times-Herald">Dallas Times-Herald</a>" and "<a href="Fort%20Worth%20Star-Telegram">Fort Worth Star-Telegram</a>". He then worked for 25 years in Philadelphia covering the <a href="Philadelphia%20Phillies">Philadelphia Phillies</a> for the "<a href="Philadelphia%20Daily%20News">Philadelphia Daily News</a>", starting in 1987. He now works for <a href="MLB.com">MLB.com</a>, as a national reporter focusing on the Phillies.
Hagen was named the recipient of the <a href="J.%20G.%20Taylor%20Spink%20Award">J. G. Taylor Spink Award</a> by the <a href="Baseball%20Writers%27%20Association%20of%20America">Baseball Writers' Association of America</a> in December 2012, and formally received the award on July 27, 2013 at the annual <a href="National%20Baseball%20Hall%20of%20Fame%20and%20Museum">Hall of Fame</a> Awards Presentation in <a href="Cooperstown%2C%20New%20York">Cooperstown, New York</a>. The presentation took place the day before the Hall's induction ceremony for its 2013 class.
